go_to_archive_button: Haven't read enough? Go to the archive!
conference_description: The Fachschaft Computerlinguistik Heidelberg is looking forward to welcoming you in 2026 for the 35th annual student-led conference on Computational Linguistics.
conference_description_2: SAVE THE DATE! Our TaCoS will take place from Thursday, May 21st to Saturday, May 23rd, 2026.
archive_description: Here you'll find links to the websites of previous TaCoS conferences. Whether you're planning your own TaCoS, want to reminisce, or are looking for something specific, the pages from the past are preserved here. Enjoy browsing!
team_description: This TaCoS conference is organized as always by dedicated students, without whose voluntary help such an event would not be possible.
team_description_lower_lead: Therefore, we would like to extend a big thank you to everyone who supports us in organizing this conference.
team_organizers_description: The main organizers of this TaCoS are Valentin Hoepfl and Aaron Henning.
friends_description_lead: Presenting: the Fachschaft Computerlinguistik (Student Body of Computational Linguistics) at Heidelberg University.
friends_description: At Heidelberg University, which has existed since 1386 and is thus the oldest university in Germany, Computational Linguistics is a rather small degree program. Many know Heidelberg University as a beautiful university in the old town, but there is also a brutalist building complex in the Neuenheimer Feld district, where the computational linguistics Heidelberg were moved some time ago.
friends_description_2: Here we need some more text to fill the page lalala blablabla a few words here and there
friends_link_to_coli_homepage: Learn more about the student body here:
what_is_description:
TaCoS (Tagung der Computerlinguistik-Studierenden - Conference of Computational Linguistics Students) was first organized in 1992 and takes place annually.
It is a conference organized by computational linguistics students for computational linguistics students and offers students of computational linguistics and related fields the opportunity to exchange ideas through presentations and workshops.
The conference is hosted by teams of student volunteers at their university, working with associations and companies as sponsors. The conference focuses on presentations and workshops given by students for students. Established researchers from the host university are also invited as keynote speakers.
In addition, there is a social program that gives all participants the opportunity to make contacts and network.

In short: TaCoS exists to meet others from your field of study, to learn something, and to have fun.
sponsors_description: An event like TaCoS would not be possible without the support of sponsors. Therefore, we are very grateful for all sponsors who support us.
sponsors_description_costs: Costs that we face include accommodation, catering, materials for workshops and presentations, and promotional materials. Beyond financial support, we also welcome donations in kind, such as promotional gifts that we can distribute to participants.
sponsors_lead: We are currently looking for sponsors. If you or your company are interested in supporting us, please contact us at
timetable_description_lead: The 35th TaCoS 2026 will take place from Thursday, May 21st to Saturday, May 23rd. The exact schedule will be published here as soon as it is finalized.
until_then_text: Until then, go check out the websites of previous conferences:
